comments.author: Sudha
comments.content: I too thought, the film was just good! Nothing extraodinary, but entertaining! and yes, its definitely "shankar-inspired"! And Vikram soopera irundan! ;) shreya, as usual...avalukku vera yedhavadhu panna theriyuma nu kooda i dont know! and additional (thevailladha) touch dan namba "item-song"! that cudve been avoided! :D

comments.author: Senthil Kumar
comments.content: ya da... it was good. Compared to other tamil movies it was far far good. i would give 4 stars! ;) This shld do good in box office. Otherwise i'll stop blaming tamil directors for taking worse movies. Tamil audiences shld appreciate and welcome these kinda good works. let's see. "No , i didnt count ‘Yaavarum Nalam’ as Vikram comes out with a hammer and all." LOL!

comments.author: impactor
comments.content: I really cant infer what made the producer Kalaipuli S Dhanu waste all dat money on this "visual distravaganza".. I believe had.. Shriya Saran been chucked out of the movie storyline and all those songs (more than an hour of them, i presume) removed except for one the Cheyaan with deliver boys sing-song.. this movie could have been improvised to an extent never seen before in Tamil cinema.. off course the cinematography is highly commendable.. but why all this masala..to put in a rightful social message??? I seriously feel it's high time Tamil Cinema shud get over this masala cacoethes, and focus on improving all aspects of the film,.. the mos important of which, i have found to be the script and editing.. i know for a fact that most of the talkies in town are overbooked, but isnt this torture for the tamil 'makkal' especially shriya in all those horrendous, loathful song sequences and attire. I had Vikram in high regard, even before Anniyan.. and cant really comprehend at least, why he couldnt put an end to the masala overdose and stick to the core point of the film.. Tamil makkal.. get over this masala-lusting nature and ask for what is more reasonably visually appealing for your 2-3 hrs of dat money.

comments.author: srinath
comments.content: yet to see the movie but when doing big budget films,they won't take big risk by leaving songs,comedy and fights.Tamil ppl really need everything in a movie to the money they spend.your review is good...

comments.author: Pradep
comments.content: Hmmm . Thats a valid point . But someone should try it out atleast . How do audience react for a movie with just the juice and none of the extra toppings . Some wealthy producer must try it out :P .

comments.author: Pradep
comments.content: I agree . It is like they shot the important and thought provoking shots of the movie first , then shot useless Shriya shots and added them on to it like tomato sauce on sandwich . Hmmm masala is something which tamil industry thrives on . So these movies will look shitty unless that concept is broken . Movies like Kuruthi Punal must rise again . Think what would have happened if Kamal and Gautami had danced for a Duet song shot in the Alps for kuruthipunal . Thats what has happened in Kandasamy . This must be a lesson for all these Concept Directors . Nevertheless seeing the original aspect of the movie , it was a good effort .

No clear evidence. Nevertheless, for tamil people, u can make a paper rocket and claim u worked with NASA !! for an average 50rupees ticket, shriya's striptease is an eye treat to TAMIL people. Dont include me :)
